DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study study effect topical Vitamin D cream ( Calcipotriene , also know Dovonex ) face bacteria cause acne . The information gain study may lead new treatment acne . In study , Calcipotriene compare placebo , cream look like Calcipotriene , contain active ingredient .
DOC.brief_title: `` Clinical Trial Determine Efficacy Vitamin D Acne Therapy ''
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize , double-blinded , parallel group comparison calcipotriene vs. placebo cream . Patients acne use calcipotriene placebo cream 2x/day 12 week assess week 0 , 2 , 4 , 8 12 . Each group 24 subject calculated power analysis . Three additional subject group recruit possible dropout total 27 subject recruit group . Primary endpoint ( lesion count ) secondary endpoint describe aims 3.2-3.4 determine . Lesion count assess one investigator physicians nurse practitioner . Adverse effect include irritation , dry skin , inflammation worsen lesion note visit . Photographs take aid assess clinical change .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 18 year old , either gender racial/ethnic group 2 . Subjects must clinically evident mild moderate acne vulgaris facial area , IGA scale , grade 24 3 . Subjects must understand sign inform consent prior participation 4 . Subjects must generally good health 5 . Subjects must able willing comply requirement protocol 1 . Oral retinoid use within twelve month entry study 2 . Systemic acne therapy ( oral antibiotic ) within 30 day entry study 3 . Topical acne therapy ( retinoids , antibiotic ) within 14 day entry study 4 . Noncompliant patient 5 . Pregnant nursing woman 6 . Subjects significant medical history concurrent condition investigator ( ) feel safe study participation 7 . Subjects hypercalcemia ( hyperparathyroidism , kidney disease ) 8 . Subjects avoid excessive exposure either natural artificial sunlight .
